edu.umn.cs.spatialHadoop

Class OperationsParams

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration
      • edu.umn.cs.spatialHadoop.OperationsParams
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Map.Entry<String,String>>, org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable

    public class OperationsParams
extends org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration
    A class that encapsulates all parameters sent for an operations implemented in SpatialHadoop. Internally, it stores everything in Configuration which makes it easier to pass around to mappers and reducers. It can be initialized from a configuration and/or a list of command line arguments.
    Author:
    Ahmed Eldawy

      • checkInput

        public boolean checkInput()
                   throws IOException
        Checks that there is at least one input path and that all input paths exist. It treats all user-provided paths as input. This is useful for input-only operations which do not take any output path (e.g., MBR and Aggregate).
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one input path and all input paths exist.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • checkInputOutput

        public boolean checkInputOutput()
                         throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • checkInputOutput

        public boolean checkInputOutput(boolean outputRequired)
                         throws IOException
        Makes standard checks for input and output files. It is assumes that all files are input files while the last one is the output file. First, it checks that there is at least one input file. Then, it checks that every input file exists. After that, it checks for output file, if it exists and the overwrite flag is not present, it fails.
        Returns:
        true if all checks pass. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the method could not get the information of the input

      • setShape

        public static void setShape(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
            String param,
            Shape shape)
        Sets the specified configuration parameter to the current value of the shape. Both class name and shape values are encoded in one string and set as the value of the configuration parameter. The shape can be retrieved later using SpatialSite.getShape(Configuration, String).
        Parameters:
        conf - The configuration to update
        param - The name of the configuration line to set
        shape - An object to set in the configuration

      • autoDetectShape

        public boolean autoDetectShape()
        Auto detect shape type based on input format
        Returns:
        true if a shape is already present in the configuration or it is auto detected from input files. false if it was not set and could not be detected.

      • detectShape

        public static String detectShape(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path path,
                 org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
                          throws IOException,
                                 InterruptedException
        Detects the shape of the given set of files assuming all of them hold data of the same shape. It reads a random set of lines and uses the detectShape(String[]) method to detect the shape of this sample set of lines.
        Parameters:
        path - Input path to read data from
        conf - The configuration parameters of the environment
        Returns:
        The detected type of the shape or null if failed.
        Throws:
        IOException
        InterruptedException

      • detectShape

        public static String detectShape(String[] lines)
        Detects the shape from a sample set of lines
        Parameters:
        lines -
        Returns:

      • isLocal

        public static boolean isLocal(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration jobConf,
              org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path... input)
                       throws IOException,
                              InterruptedException
        Checks whether the operation should work in local or MapReduce mode. If the job explicitly specifies whether to run in local or MapReduce mode, the specified option is returned. Otherwise, it automatically detects whether to use local or MapReduce based on the input size.
        Returns:
        true to run in local mode, false to run in MapReduce mode.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the underlying job fails with an IOException
        InterruptedException - If the underlying job was interrupted
